website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight but capable edger with a well-designed footplate and a mid-range price.
pros: Boasts a wide footplate that reduces strain while maximizing leverage
Pointed blade cuts easily through most sod and grass
Construction feels solid, yet it is reasonably lightweight, making it a good choice for consumers who have limited strength
cons: Somewhat awkward for very tall individuals to work with
Soil occasionally gathers under the blade, so you'll have to remove it manually to continue working

customer_reviews.title: Paid $25 - after using it I would have paid $50.
customer_reviews.text: It's everything it's advertised to do, but the most important part is that your foot goes right over the middle of the blade, making it almost effortless to create a shoveled edge around a mulch patch. I basically leave my right foot in the foothold, and sidestep all the way around the bed, and step down, side step, step down, side step. You get the point. It goes so fast I almost started laughing a few times. I'll have one of these in my shed forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Created natural edging in flower beds!
customer_reviews.text: I got the flower beds all tidied up with the combination of this chopper, a garden trowel and some elbow grease. First we chopped our line, then used a spade to dig out a slight ditch at a 45 degree angle against the line, for a natural edging. We pulled out the weeds / grass, and voila! See pics! Took about 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Sincerity

customer_reviews.title: Bad weld destroyed tool in under an hour
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 1 hr and welded part to half circle wasn’t welded in right place and just came completely off- Get your manufacturing welders to learn where to weld- I will consider changing my review upon replacement and refund-
customer_reviews.author: Devin Koser

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good edge, seems ver durable
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Used in Michigan in the fall to edge out a new landscape bed. Do your grass removal for beds in MI in the fall! SO much easier than all those times I was doing ‘spring’ projects well into June/July. So, I didn’t give it a hard ground workout. But, seems it will also handle that well. I plan to use it to create grooves for edging next year. Ran out of yard work weather this year. Which is good, my back was ready for a winters rest! Ibuprofen sold separately! 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Manual edging made easy. I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It's built well, but not too heavy. the t-shaped handle is easy to grip and solid. I love the stepping action to drive it into the ground. It saves your arms and back from fatigue. It cut a perfect line along my driveway and even served to scoop up loose sod on the concrete​. It's slow work, but easy on your body. I would certainly buy again, but expect it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Homer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good tool but could have a longer handle (for someone that's tall like me). I don't object to the tool other than I spent about $30 for something I already had in my shed. My back started getting sore so I went to my shed and got out my flat shovel and used that instead. The shovel was easier to handle when picking up the sod I'd cut away from the walk, edging, etc. I'll keep it and use it for little touchups as needed.
customer_reviews.author: raginbull

customer_reviews.title: Great Edger
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I wanted something that I could use so I did not have to fire up anything gas or electric as I find that difficult. I am a senior (yuck) and cannot handle all that I used to handle. This also takes care of the smaller jobs -- around flower beds, etc. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Great garden edging tool!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! This is a fantastic edging tool if you don't mind putting in the work. Very easy to use. Simple step and rock motion that cuts through roots, then the grass and weeds can be pulled away.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a sturdy tool that does its job
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Needed an edger for, as you guessed it, edging purposed. Have used it to cut back the overgrowth on our sidewalk/walkway, to help create the divide between our garden beds and the lawn, and to create the divide for a paver patio I put in a few months ago. I've had it for a few months and it seems to be very durable. Will even run up against rock/burried asphalt and hasn't had any damage to speak of. The tip has slightly degraded but again, that's because i've run it down straight into hurried asphalt on accident. So far has lived up to the billing and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TheGreatBambino

customer_reviews.title: Has become my favorite yard tool.
customer_reviews.text: Here in North Texas we have a lot of clay in our soil, making it very hard to dig. But this tool makes it very easy to break ground. I used it to contour holes around new fence posts. I also used it to lay some new in-ground drain pipe. It is also great for making a professional edge around flower beds. It has become my favorite yard tool.
customer_reviews.author: PositiveMojo

customer_reviews.title: Soil buildup
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, this is a well built and sturdy tool. My only criticism of the design is that dirt really seems to adhere to it and after a short while it has built up enough dirt that it is no longer effective and needs to be scraped clean with a garden shovel. The condition is probably worsened by our clay soil in north carolina but I think I wish I purchased a simpler flat design.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good product / tool matches task required of it.
customer_reviews.text: You have got to be kidding. Somebody actually thought a product through? For length of handle, for foot placement, for blade cutter shape, for ease of stomp, even for knocking off clay (What the rennels are on the blade do when you use a scraper.) this device is almost perfect as an edging tool. The operator must be patient and work at it when passing through root growth, but short of an electric edger, this is the easiest tool for purpose I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Tested and evaluated

customer_reviews.title: This tool does NOT get the job done
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very light weight and did not work to edge my garden. The light weight was noticeable immediately and a big disappointment. In addition, the flat area where you put your foot to apply pressure (and weight) is very small, my 7.5 female size sneaker barely fit. All in all this tool is a joke. Oh and the spade aspect of this tool which is meant to cut through the grass, soil, roots, etc.... has no sharpness whatsoever, so it doesn't work. I have an old spade about 20 years old that still works much better than this. I would return but not sure if I still have the box. Absolutely 100% do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Servin

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this based on the good reviews, especially concerning St Augustine grass
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the good reviews, especially concerning St Augustine grass. I cannot get it to cut through even a sparse section of grass, basically standing on the thing. I thought there must be a protective blade cap, but no, it's just dull. I'm going to try to sharpen it, but not sure I can make much of an improvement which pretty much renders it useless for me. More unfortunately, I received and was billed for two. 😪
customer_reviews.author: Largoann

customer_reviews.title: A great manual edger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great edger, very affordable, easy to use and highly effective. I chose a manual over electric, because it gets me some additional activity, and this one was a great choice. Never had any type of issues using it, cuts through small roots and dirt easily, is very sturdy and it currently has been stored after its 5th year of usage. Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RCN

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I have horrible rocky and clay soil that is impossible to dig in. This tool is very sturdy and makes a difficult task much easier and with effort creates a very clean edge. I like the fact that you use one foot in the center as opposed to some that have the pole in the middle so you have to use both feet on either side (like a pogo stick). You can't do that with soil (rocks) like mine without landing on your face.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Davis

customer_reviews.title: Slices through rocky, clay soil
customer_reviews.text: Slices through my rocky, clay soil like a hot knife through butter. The side having a sort of scoop helps to mound up the soil. I re-edged all of my garden beds in a couple of hours (would have taken a couple of back breaking days)
customer_reviews.author: K. Longwell

customer_reviews.title: A good Manual Edge Chopper
customer_reviews.text: It works, though it bends some of my grass instead of cutting through it. Using a weed wacker or powered edger gives better results but for a manual tool this works very well. Just the right height for a six footer so you don't have to bend over and strain your back. Just hold on, put your foot on the pad, and push down. Fast, simple, and strong.
customer_reviews.author: usafpj

customer_reviews.title: How Did This Product Get Such Great Reviews?
customer_reviews.text: I don't get it. Yesterday I tried out this edger and it did absolutely nothing. I struggled to get it to cut into our crabgrass. Nothing. I could try again, but I don't feel like taking 10 years to edge our front lawn. I ended up yanking the crabgrass with my bare hands along the sidewalk. Perhaps the weed wacker will do a better job of it.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: I cannot speak for how well it works. People ...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak for how well it works. People had said theirs came with a sharpened blade which is why I bought this product. The blade does not come sharpened & you would have a hard time cutting butter with it. If you are handy & have the tools essential for sharpening the blade. Then this will not be an issue for you. I will report back once I have the blade sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Dessenberg

customer_reviews.title: ... but the garden weasel has made our walkways look great. The tool is sturdy and has a nice ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of effort but the garden weasel has made our walkways look great. The tool is sturdy and has a nice step platform. We have used it to cut grass for replacement sod in a section of our lawn. It actually works better after a few uses as the concrete for the sidewalk will sharpen the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Spade!
customer_reviews.text: I--a 31-year-old woman with weak little arms--just landscaped a giant portion of my lawn SINGLE-HANDEDLY using ONLY THIS SPADE. Holy cow it was amazing! I recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: SparklesTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: This works, it's easy to use, I'm not strong and I edged along the sidewalk so easily. I wish I had a shovel made like this. Placing your foot centered and pushing down makes so much sense. Why isn't there a shovel like this, I'd buy it! If I was going to gift an edger I'd give this one.
customer_reviews.author: Granny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the women gardener
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! What makes it ideal for me is the shorter length. Im a petite women and this gadget is so easy for me handle. My foot perfectly through the center hole, its lightweight but strong and its designed to allow for some “shoveling” and shimming, not just edging. The only con is that if you are a big and tall man you might find this a little bit short and undersized
customer_reviews.author: C Voight

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy!
customer_reviews.text: I have already used this to open a small trench to bury an electrical cord a few inches underground to keep it from being hit by lawn mowers. Didn't take long for the trench to close up since I didn't have to use a shovel to dig up the area.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley B.

customer_reviews.title: Edging a Big Yard, Yeah this is it...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to edge 4,000 sq ft of new sod. While a manual process, this bad boy cut through sod like butter. I was originally worried about the curves and slopes - not a problem at all. If you are an edging perfectionist like me - buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad D Harbert

customer_reviews.title: Even stands up to southern clay!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how this ripped right through hard southern clay when making an edge by the driveway - Impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Costner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and strong
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome! I tried edging with an electric edger, and then used this edger. Once you get the hang of lining up your cuts, you can move along quickly. My yard looks great and didn’t break my back getting it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Great for Women
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these before & it went missing...so happy I found this in Amazon. Good price & sturdy. Perfect for women- easy to handle and makes a really clean line along garden boarders.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Belue

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The best one out there. Really easy to use. Your foot doesn't slip off and you don't need a whole lot of pressure to push down. Extremely stury. I gave my first one away when I moved to LA because I had an apartment but bought this second one when I moved back into my house again. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: SuperDog

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste, it only digs a shallow edge. A normal spade is a much better tool. Edging needs to be at least 4" to be effective at keeping grass out of your mulched areas. This won't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Crissie

customer_reviews.title: RUGGED GROUND
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend. Her son was working on get a summer's worth of ground tilled and edged in her garden area. He used a number of tools and found none to work well. I recommended the Garden Weasel. Amazon made it easy to find and I purchased it for her. She and her son have been very pleased and impressed on the quality and how easy it was to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Returning and buying a power edger
customer_reviews.text: Works well in moist soft ground but WILL NOT penetrate hard dry clayish soils. Cutting edge is blunt. The balanced centered foot step design seems good at first look but you Can't get enough weight on one foot to cut harder spots
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this to create that sharp edging around my 22 fruit trees as well as my two ornamental trees. This worked perfect. I had no issues using this, but I did wait until a good rain so the soil was easier to manage. I think this is what has caused many issues for others.
customer_reviews.author: Detharal

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! So much easier than a shovel! Sharp blade cuts right thru sod. Easy on my knees! I’m 5’ 7” , 66 yr old female. Perfect length. Great Tool!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: I hate the electric trimmers because the string always breaks
customer_reviews.text: I hate the electric trimmers because the string always breaks. With this I have full control and don't have to waste time with string. It cuts through the ground very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a must have! It really makes a huge difference in the appearance of flower beds. Our neighbors all have their yards professionally landscaped and this tool makes ours fit in with them. Highly recommended and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: T Cies

customer_reviews.title: I used this while wearing flip flops.
customer_reviews.text: I used to edge my lawn with my weed eater, tilted sideways. I got this thing, and now I can put a crisp edge on the grass without having gravel and debris flung into my face. So far, the quality is good, and it is comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy with it sturdy no way bend break as one ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this sucker to cut sod across a 30-40 foot yard for dry creek bed, took a while but without it would have been he--l. I am so happy with it sturdy no way bend break as one solid piece but pricer than the others but get what you pay for. I used it today as edger, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the power edger... this thing is where it's at! I live on a corner lot and we edged our driveway, walkways AND sidewalk both sides in a few hours. It's easy to use, makes a nice edge and cleans up well.
customer_reviews.author: TXEggplant

customer_reviews.title: Great little edger
customer_reviews.text: I use this for edging all of my yard. I love the way it makes a definitive border near the sidewalks and drive. It's really easy to use and makes edging go quickly. My neighbors all use a weed eater to edge. My yard looks professional and the neighbors have been asking about this great little edger.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: A very handy garden tool.
customer_reviews.text: Had to do extensive edging of beds on my property. This was tedious and painful due to issues with my shoulder. My old edger required a lot of arm involvement when forcing edger into the ground and it didn't always make a straight line. But THIS edger is much easier. All force is applied with your foot and designed to lift away the adjacent dirt on a 45° degree angle which is perfect when looking to add mulch. I love this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Use to edge beds and edge lawn at driveway. Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Long Islander

customer_reviews.title: The perfect manual edger!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Just what I was looking for. Once you get the hang of it, you can cut some nice edges in a short amount of time. We used to rent a professional edger. My husband won't use this as he's not into manual work over automated but I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great edging my sidewalk
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Great edging my sidewalk. Found to have the soil moist and needed to use the rocking motion and put center down into area I had rocked. It was much easier than I thought possible.
customer_reviews.author: Miss CB

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have very loose soil or sand thus tool will not help you. I put all my weight on this and was only able to make a small shallow dent in the ground. I put it in my out building and considered it a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: patricia mccommas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool
customer_reviews.text: I used it to dig a shallow trench across my yard for antenna wire. It's slow going though. If you're the impatient type, you may want a gas or electric trenching tool of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I am not so great with a weed whacker or edger so I decided to buy this and give it a try. I am able to edge my yard and flower bed easily. The edge is nice and sharp and cuts through the grass well and it is well made. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cgilbert

customer_reviews.title: Chop! Chop!
customer_reviews.text: Update 2019 We still love this garden tool. NO RUST and it has been in use all the time. We are slowly reducing the backyard lawn size and this has been helpful in defining the new borders. I love to use this! Works great! I can chop roots and define borders. My wife and I used it to clean the front yard which was neglected since it was a foreclosure house. Now we have defined borders. It is holding up really well. Still looks new after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Island Capture

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for those of us who like to extend ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for those of us who like to extend our garden beds little by little each season ! It's easy to work into the soil and gives a crisp clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: soccermom2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for me.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use yet. However, it does look very sturdy and I'm sure it will do the job it says it does. I will update when I do get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this thing is life changing
customer_reviews.text: I'm so surprised at how well this took works. Using your body weight it's easy to get it into the ground, and then it just pops grass or weeds right up.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie

customer_reviews.title: Affordably Priced, Simple, Multi-Use for Multiple Seasons
customer_reviews.text: Great for weeding & keeping path borders neat, tidy & even helps loosen stubborn weeds. Item is so sturdy, found 2nd use for it Winter-time - breaks up ice on driveways & walkways w/out harming the surface below.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Critic

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool and was excited to find it here. My neighbor had one I borrowed (hated returning it but reluctantly did). Well the next spring I bought my own! This is strong! I feel like I’ll own this for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Beth Polonsky

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money if you’re actually trying to edge your garden
customer_reviews.text: I hated this thing! You’re better off just buying a edger from Lowe’s...far easier to use and FAR MORE EFFECTIVE. I’m a young women and found this tool VERY difficult to use. The edge of the weasel wasn’t even sharp enough to cut through three inches of ground. Waste of time, effort, and money. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Well, it's ok if you can't buy a powered one !
customer_reviews.text: For an edging tool... works fine, but needs a bit of 'getting used' too. How to cut the correct edge on the lawn. Also requires a bit of grunt for doing a large lawn.
customer_reviews.author: TZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for the Landscaping Arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool - works exactly as advertised. Very sturdy and strong. Cuts right through the sod so you can properly edge out a new garden bed. Once you experience the benefit of being able to place your foot directly over the center of the shovel, you will never want to go back
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Schwoppe

customer_reviews.title: Good Solution and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used it to clean up edges next to curbs and sidewalks. Now my regular manual grass edger can maintain. I could use it easily., all you need is your foot. This Works Nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas.H.Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good edging tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great for edging. Very sturdy. Got it for keeping a drainage area on each side of my sidewalk but will use it on my gardens.
customer_reviews.author: BDS

customer_reviews.title: Needs a sharper edge
customer_reviews.text: We ended up sharpening the edge so it would cut better. We have very thick crab grass that it had trouble with. Otherwise it was okay, something that I could manage on my own rather than needing my husband to help.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easily used, good ground penetration and leverage
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Putting your weight in the middle of the blade makes a big difference in the depth and uniformity of ground penetration.
customer_reviews.author: gs777

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard and need a low cost edging option. This is a prefect solution. I opened box and edged in 10 minutes and the yard looked so much nicer
customer_reviews.author: Tom Collins

customer_reviews.title: function and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I used after a heavy rain when the soil was soft, and still had to work really hard to cut a straight line, only to find later that many runners were missed. Went back to cutting with grass clippers. Perhaps I'll look into a rotary hand edger. This might work if the area needing edging is really small and you can go over several times to get it all.
customer_reviews.author: dee Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-Tool
customer_reviews.text: A quick sharpening with file and it was ready for work. Cuts through roots well and just deep enough for an edge. I also used this to cut in a small walking path on my sloping property and the shape helps double duty as a small shovel, which worked pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: This worked surprisingly well, I was thinking it might be kind of hard to use but it cuts the edges like a charm
customer_reviews.author: cside

customer_reviews.title: soft soil a must
customer_reviews.text: works great but the soil must be soft. wait for a day after a rain or prewater the ground.
customer_reviews.author: golden goose

customer_reviews.title: This edger works with the greatest of ease
customer_reviews.text: This edger works with the greatest of ease. I like the design especially the blade. The blade comes to a point making it easier to use compared to the rounded edge of some edgers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It is so handy
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I use it for so many yard jobs now. it edges great. it is light weight and so easy for me to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Britton

customer_reviews.title: Was really bummed about this... i was ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really bummed about this...i was so excited to get it, but it didn't work well in cutting through the St. Augustine grass At times it didn't even edge at all. Used my shovel instead, which worked very well. Had to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bkwrms

customer_reviews.title: Great for edging beds
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and makes a great end result. Sturdy, light, and has a sharp edge. I could see this lasting a lifetime if cared for properly.
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY O. BUCKLEY

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easier to use then I imagined it would be. I thought I was going to have to jump up and down on it in order to cut into the lawn but it works well with just a little effort even for a 65 year old it was not hard to handle.
customer_reviews.author: NCSC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built,  works well, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well built. Works well. It was a little hard cutting edges, but it was perhaps due to the type of thick grass, St. Augustine, I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Trejo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent edging tool. Well built, sturdy, comfortable. My lawn is not huge so no clumsy electric or gas-powered machine necessary. This is perfect for my suburban yard.
customer_reviews.author: RobertW

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even better after sharpening
customer_reviews.text: I had 10x10 area to remove sod from and this worked wonderfully. The center step is very nice. I found that I could cut both side of a line then go back and make perpendicular cuts every 3-4 inches and then used it to cut from underneath and lift the sod out, sometimes even toss it up into the wheelbarrow. I highly recommend sharpening it up a bit with a file or grinder before you get started as it made it much easier to get through the touch field grass that I was removing.
customer_reviews.author: O. Rodabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Foot placement makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly made tool that does a great job of edging. It is sharp (and you can make it sharper with a file if desired), and the hole for foot placement makes it work like a dream. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Van Scoy

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut through grass
customer_reviews.text: Does not cut through grass. Nevermind the roots, we couldn't even get through grass blades. Tried in the grass next to driveway ( cement) and plastic edging next to flower beds. We live in Michigan for reference, in case our grass is extra tuff.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: This is the edger to get.
customer_reviews.text: Im glad I spent the extra money to buy this one. It's built to last forever. I found it very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Best Edger Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products where you wonder why you've gone so long w/o it. It performs amazingly on the first plunge into the dirt, cutting through earth like butter, rock it back and forth and you have a small trench to install edging panels. Way better than edging w a small hand tool or a pick axe.
customer_reviews.author: artistclare

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and it worked so much better than my electric edger.
customer_reviews.author: pismopatti

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use !
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for the edges along my driveway. The foot plate is large enough to where you can put your whole weight on it with very little effort. Highly recommend !!!
customer_reviews.author: HappyWomanToo

customer_reviews.title: Hard for me to use
customer_reviews.text: I can’t imagine edging my whole lawn with this. I found it very difficult. Decided to just use a weed whacker. It does feel very sturdy. Maybe my technique is wrong? Best of luck
customer_reviews.author: Riley B

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd found this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed and works great. Yes, it takes a bit of effort the first time along an edge, but it's easier after that, and it's so much better than trying to do the job with the constant breaking or snagging line of a string trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Must have in your shed
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to use !!! Not cheap Like others that are sold.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: and did a nice edging between the sidewalk and lawn. I do have to wear my work boots vs. sneakers though to get enough force to make the clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: Knitty Purl

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I am a big guy. 6'2". The handle is a little short for me, but works well. We have moderately sandy soil. This tool handled edging along the curb very well. This product is very well made. A quick sharpen with a grinder would make it work even better. Great price and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B. Markel

customer_reviews.title: It awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this edger. Makes cleaning up the garden very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Stewart

customer_reviews.title: I love this. I was worried my weight wouldn't be ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I was worried my weight wouldn't be enough to chop down on it but I did just fine! Very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: jlm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, made a noticeable difference
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product. I thought that it would take along time to do all of the edging I needed, but it was a breeze. It gives a cleaner look to the lawn, sidewalks and garden.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: ... circle around my Japanese Maple and it did a great job. Easy to use and hang onto when ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to extend the circle around my Japanese Maple and it did a great job. Easy to use and hang onto when making the cut in the sod. Great hand tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Light and sturdy. Great product. The t handle makes it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Riddlin

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as I would like.
customer_reviews.text: The edge is not sharp enough to cut through our grass and ground. But, I'm trying to make it work. I have to make sure the ground is very wet to use it.
customer_reviews.author: jwar

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I’m a small woman and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Wow - Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Wow - Awesome. I was going to rent a machine to edge -this did the trick. Great design, easy to use and very strong. The design is so good - you are wondering why you did think of it first.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really makes an edging choir easier and will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well for the soil in my customer's lawns
customer_reviews.text: Defnitely built well and might work well for some soils, in missouri's rocky clay soil however this edger just doesn't get the job done and is more trouble to use then it's wortk. You're better off getting a solid, heavy garden spade from your local nursery.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tool!,
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tool! Easy to use and does a wonderful job. Would recommend to anyone needing a good edger.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This works great for edging. I edged my whole front yard with this in an hour with kids piking up and tossing the grass edges I cut off. Recommended over the gas or electric, as this works well, does not waste natural resources, does not pollute, does not kick up dust and grass in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Our neighbor let me borrow it one day and it was so great, I had to buy one. Heavy duty and well made!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through my grass more easily than my flat spade
customer_reviews.text: I'm not that strong and really have a hard time cutting through the grass so the triangle edge helps. But the flat spade is better at shoveling out the soil after cutting .
customer_reviews.author: Sanders

customer_reviews.title: My garden/mulch beds needed a good edging as the previous owners of the house never ...
customer_reviews.text: My garden/mulch beds needed a good edging as the previous owners of the house never tended to them. This tool is just what I needed and is super simple to use and leaves a nice edge!
customer_reviews.author: DA

product_meta.title: Garden Weasel Edge Chopper
product_meta.description: Sometimes the simplest ideas are the best. The durable Edge Chopper makes creating edges for your lawn and garden simple, quick, and pain-free. It’s easy to use, easy to maintain, and less expensive than rolling wheel models. The Garden Weasel Edge Chopper effortlessly creates sculpted edges for gardens, patios, driveways, and curbs. It can cleanly separate flowers, shrubs, or ground cover areas from lawns, which is helpful for keeping mulch in and grass out of your beds. In the wintertime, you can use it to break up ice! This multifunctional garden tool is ergonomically designed to reduce pain from bending or straining and features wide foot plate for increased leverage. To use, simply place the Edge Chopper where you want to create an edge, step with your foot, and remove! The Garden Weasel Edge Chopper has steel welded construction with a carbon steel blade. It is weather resistant and rust resistant for maximum longevity. Package includes (1) Garden Weasel Edge Chopper. Overall height: 38-Inches
feature_bullets: SAVE TIME, EFFORT, MONEY, AND BACK! – Sometimes the simplest ideas are the best. The durable Edge Chopper makes creating edges for your lawn and garden simple, quick, and pain-free. It’s easy to use, easy to maintain, and less expensive than rolling wheel models.

CREATE ATTRACTIVE GARDEN LINES – The Garden Weasel Edge Chopper effortlessly creates sculpted edges for gardens, patios, driveways, and curbs. It can cleanly separate flowers, shrubs, or ground cover areas from lawns, which is helpful for keeping mulch in and grass out of your beds. In the wintertime, you can use it to break up ice!

EASY TO USE IN THE BACKYARD – This multifunctional garden tool is ergonomically designed to reduce pain from bending or straining and features wide foot plate for increased leverage. To use, simply place the Edge Chopper where you want to create an edge, step with your foot, and remove!
DURABLE STEEL CONSTRUCTION – The Garden Weasel Edge Chopper has steel welded construction with a carbon steel blade. It is weather resistant and rust resistant for maximum longevity.
PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS – Package includes (1) Garden Weasel Edge Chopper. Overall height: 38-Inches
